content:
The eternal struggle with desk clutter! I'm glad to hear that your daily 10-minute tidy of the living room is working out well for you, though!

To help you tackle your desk clutter, I'd be happy to offer some suggestions. Here are a few ideas to get you started:

1. **Create a "Touch Once" system**: Try to handle each piece of paper or note only once. When you touch it, deal with it immediately. Either file it away, toss it, or take action on it.
2. **Designate a "Landing Strip"**: Choose a specific area on your desk as a "landing strip" where you'll place all incoming papers and notes. This will help contain the clutter and make it easier to process.
3. **Use a Paper Tray System**: Set up a paper tray or file organizer with separate sections for different types of papers (e.g., "To-Do," "To-File," "To-Read," etc.). This will help you categorize and prioritize your papers.
4. **Implement the "2-Minute Rule"**: If a task or paper can be dealt with in less than 2 minutes, do it immediately. This will help you stay on top of small tasks and reduce clutter.
5. **Schedule a Weekly "Desk Detox"**: In addition to your daily 10-minute tidy, set aside 30 minutes to an hour each week to thoroughly clean and organize your desk. This will help you stay on track and maintain your space.
6. **Consider a Digital Note-Taking System**: If you're finding it hard to keep track of paper notes, consider switching to a digital note-taking app like Evernote, OneNote, or Simplenote. This can help reduce paper clutter and make it easier to search and organize your notes.
7. **Set up a "Someday" Box**: Designate a box or folder for items that don't have a deadline or can be dealt with later. This will help you clear your desk of clutter and focus on more pressing tasks.

Remember, the key to maintaining a tidy desk is to create a system that works for you and stick to it consistently.

What do you think? Is there one of these suggestions that resonates with you, or do you have any other ideas you'd like to try?
